pullRequest.title: Add Player context to AnvilUpdateEvent
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds the player using the Anvil to the context of the AnvilUpdateEvent.
It also updates the documentation of the event significantly, as it was pretty bare before.  Most of the changes involve the comments (the changes to add the player to the event were rather minor).
The old constructor and old ForgeHooks method have been deprecated as they cannot be removed without causing a breaking change.
The reason for having the player available is as follows:
I was attempting to recreate the vanilla behavior of using the anvil, but with slightly lower numbers as my mod allows for higher enchantments levels to be obtained through normal gameplay.  These higher enchantment levels make it very difficult to use the anvil, but currently, it is impossible to retain vanilla behavior for creative players and still make this modification.  The player using the anvil is required to still allow creative players to do whatever they want (such as putting enchantments on items that normally may not receive them), while still being able to change the vanilla calculations.
Another possible solution to this problem would be to add another event that fires when vanilla's implementation has completed, to allow for that result to be changed or edited.  However, I believe this solution is superior, as there are likely more uses for the player context than my scenario.
